column2: Work on commercial/market case and project description
column5: Contact program director to submit Executive Summary. (optional)
column7: Apply for a DUNS number (requires EIN tax number)
column8: Register firm with NSF Fastlane (requires EIN, DUNS)
column9: Register firm with SBIR.gov (requires EIN, DUNS)
column11: Begin to gather letters of support.
column12: Review and follow NSF SBIR FastLane instructions.
column14: All proposal components should be submitted to FastLane to avoid last-day crises.
column15: Review and double-check everything. Submit if you haven’t already!

column2: various (Lean Canvas, Business Model Canvas, etc.)
I-corps (others incl.  accelerators, lean launchpad, startup bootcamps, SBA, pitch competitions, etc.)

column5: Program Manager responds back by email and/or phone.
column11: Third-party contacts provide letters of support in writing.
column16: Administrative screen and sorting into panels completed.
column18: Some applicants may get requests for additional information. Long lead-time items not already completed (e.g. human or animal subjects approvals, cooperative research agreements, etc.) should be expedited.
column20: Money in the bank for awardees, projects begin.

column2: I-corps (Others: Global Accelerator Network for f6s)

column3: (1) This was from the journey map but not mentioned in the application instructions. Is this required? Where does incorporation status get verified? (2) How much time/cost is required?
column4: (1) Lacks ability to notify customers of future events.
column5: (1) PM responsiveness limited in the 2 weeks leading up to the solicitation deadline. (2) Customers have been known to submit to multiple PMs—sometimes as a way to get more feedback as a way to improve their chances of receiving a grant. (3) Exchanges transpire over email, making all records hard to track and manage.
column6: (1) How long does it take to obtain an EIN online?
column7: (1) How long does it take to obtain a DUNS number online?
column8: (1) How long does it take to register for Fastlane? (2) Need to identify Principal Investigator (PI)
column9: (1) How long does it take to register with SBIR?
column10: (1) How long does this process take if you’re starting from scratch?
column11: (1) Is there a template or a set of guidelines for this? (2) How is this currently submitted? (3) Can they submit soft copies? (4) Do the letters need to be notarized? I.e., how do you verify/authenticate?

column4: Gain a better understanding of the application process.
Inform and prepare potential applicants about the application process.
